text: The Regina Pats are a Canadian professional ice hockey team that began playing in 1917. They currently play in the Western Hockey League. They play their home games in Regina, Saskatchewan at the Brandt Centre. They are the oldest major junior hockey franchise in the world that has continuously operated from their original location and still uses the same name. Baseball player Nyjer Morgan played 7 games with the Pats in the 1999-2000 season and registered 2 goals and 20 penalty minutes. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:1917 establishments Category:Canadian Hockey League teams Category:Ice hockey teams in Saskatchewan Category:Western Hockey League Category:Regina, Saskatchewan Category:1910s establishments in Canada
title: Regina Pats
